title: Weobley Walks

images.title: The Weobley Magpie by Jaggery, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The Weobley Magpie and the black and white buildings some of which date back to the 1400s. The Daily Mail included Weobley in its list of the 20 most idyllic villages in Britain.

images.title: Philip Pankhurst / The lake, The Ley, Weobley
images.caption: The lake, The Ley, Weobley The humps and bumps in the field beyond suggest that this may have been the moat of an much earlier house.

images.caption: The Gables, Weobley

description: This historic Herefordshire based village is a lovely place for a stroll. The former market town includes a number of photogenic timber framed buildings and a noteworthy Norman church. This circular walk from the village visits the ruined castle at Garnstone Park before heading to the neighbouring settlement of Ledgemoor. On the way there's some pleasant countryside views, medieval buildings and two pretty lakes to see. There's also an optional extension to visit The Ley, a Grade-I listed farmhouse dating to 1589 which lies just to the west of the village. Weobley is on the Black and White Village Trail, a long distance circular walk which visits several of Herefordshire's medieval settlements. You could extend your walking in the area by following the waymarked footpath north east to visit Dilwyn and Leominster. Heading west will take you to Woonton, Logaston and Almeley.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: Back in the village head to The Sal for some post exercise relaxation and refreshment. The Grade II listed pub includes a fine interior with an oak-beamed bar. They serve delicious food and can be found at Market Pitch, HR4 8SJ.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The farmland is a pleasant place for a dog walk. The Sal mentioned above is also dog friendly.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Head north to Kington and you could pick up the wonderful Hergest Ridge Walk which takes you along a spectacular ridge from England to Wales. For more walking ideas in the area see the Herefordshire Walks page.

display_address: Ye Olde Salutation Inn, Portland Street, Weobley, Herefordshire, England, HR4 8SB, United Kingdom
